zone.line: Apollo
And I shall gaze not on the deeds which
make
My mind obscure with sorrow, as Eclipse 120
Darkens the sphere I guide—but list, I hear
The small clear silver lute of the young Spirit
That sits i the Morning star —
Ocean
Thou must away?
Even
Thy steeds will pause at [?noon ]—till when, farewell

line.del: Hark the loud Deep calls me home too, to feed it

zone.line: With azure calm out of the emerald urns
Which stand forever pale beside my throne . . .
Behold the Nereids under the green Sea
Their wavering limbs borne on the wind like
streams
Their white arms lifted oer their streaming hair 130
With garlands pied & starry sea-flower crowns ,
Hastening to grace their mighty Sisters joy
The roar of waves is heard
It is the unpastured Sea hungring for Calm
